title: Cliched retro fonts...
content:
Hello people!

This is a relatively simple one - I am looking for a selection of fonts to present to a client. The client has asked for a display face in a ’50s ‘retro’ style accustomed with the stereotyped American diner, gas station etc.

The first port of call was, of course, FontDiner.

However, fifties retro is not really a favourite genre of mine, so has anyone got their own preferred 50’s font?

Any suggestions welcomed!  
Thanks in advance.

( [MVB Bossa Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20060414084638/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=MVB.102372.0.0) is a start!)

comments.content: You also have to go to P22 they have a number of fonts that qualify

some faves:

The [House-A-Rama](http://web.archive.org/web/20060414084638/http:/houseindustries.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=7) fontkit by [House Industries](http://web.archive.org/wiki/House%20Industries).

[Jukebox](http://web.archive.org/web/20060414084638/http:/www.veer.com/products/browse.aspx?vendor=JBT&page=&view=browse).

The House site and the Veer site would be ideal to cruise around on.

Cheers dgweaver53m and paul d hunt, all good!

For reference, I have now attached the logo I am working with in relation to this project (see first post).
Well, you can’t say “American Diner” without considering [Font Diner](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Font%20Diner) and their packages such as [Country Fair Picnic or Lunchbox](http://web.archive.org/).
